bibl.title: John Matthews v. Henry M. White. Supplemental Return
bibl.note: Our transcription is based on a digital image of the microfilmed original.

org.orgName: District Court of the United States for the Western District of Washington

body.p: UNITED STATES DISTRICT COURT FOR THE WESTERN DISTRICT OF WASHINGTON NORTHERN DIVISION.
To the Honorable JEREMIAH NETERER, Judge of the District Court of the United States for the Western District of Washington.

COMES now Robert C. Saunders, United States District Attorney for the Western District of Washington, and Charlotte Kolmitz, Assistant United States Attorney for said district, attorneys for respondent, Henry M. White, United States Commissioner of Immigration for the District of Washington, and complying with the order of the Court that a further showing be made: (1) Why the petitioner is not deported to Ukrainia, or that (2) East Galacia is Ukrania under another name; and respectfully states: 1. That Ukrainia and East Galicia as now constituted are seperate, adjacent countries; 2. That Kaminetz (town), Podolska (provice), the birthplace of petitioner (see record) is in what is now Eastern Galicia. 3. That the warrant on deportation has been amended directing the deportation of petitioner to East Galacia.

That hereto attached and marked Exhibit "A" and "B" respectively, are, a letter of Henry M. White, Commissioner of Immigration, advising the receipt of a telegram from the Assistant Secretary of Labor, and original telegram from E.J. Henning, Assistant Secretary of Labor, Washington, D.C.

The said attorneys furhter desire to call the court's attention to the fact that petitioner was released from McNeil Island Penitentiary on May 5, 1921, and not February 19, 1921, as represented to the court, (see record).
Dated this 15th day of September, 1921.
Robert C. Saunders Umited States Attorney Charlotte Kolmitz Assistant United States Attorney. Attorneys for respondent.
UNITED STATES OF AMERICA WESTERN DISTRICT OF WASHINGTON SS NORTHERN DIVISION

CHARLOTTE KOLMITZ, being first duly sworn, on aoth deposes and says: That she is Assistant United States Attorney for the Western District of Washington; that she has read over the foregoing supplemental return, knows the contents thereof, and believes the same to be true, to the best of her knowledge, information and belief. Charlotte Kolmitz
Subscribed and sworn to before me this 15th day of September, 1921.
S.E. Leitch Deputy Clerk, U.S> District Court, Western District of Washington.
U.S. DEPARTMENT OF LABOR IMMIGRATION SERVICE DISTRICT NO.16
IN REPLYING TO NO. 37012/600
DISTRICT HEADQUARTERS U.S. COMMISSIONER OF IMMIGRATION SEATTLE, WASH.
EXHIBIT "A" Sept.13,1921
United States Attorney, Seattle, Washington.
Sir: Attention on Miss Kolmitz.

Referring to the habeas corpus case of JACK MATTHEWS, I get to advise that in reponse to a telegram sent to the Department of Washington, at the instance of Miss Kolmitz, the following reply has been received,

"Ukrainia and Eastern Galicia two seperate countries with seperate and distinct governments of their own. stop. Not recognized by United States. stop. Town of which Jack Matthews is native is now in Eastern Galicia, and passport had to be secured from Eastern Galician representative before deportation could take place. stop. Warrant of deportation is hereby amended directing deportation of alien to Eastern Galicia. Henning"
Mr. E.J. Henning is the Assistant Secretary of Labor.
Respectfully, Henry M. White Commissioner.
TWL/R
WESTERN UNION TELEGRAM NEWCOMB CARLTON, PRESIDENT GEORGE W. ATKINS, FIRST VICE PRESIDENT
RECEIVED AT A158EA CA 62 GOVT
WASHINGTON DC 537P SEP 13 1921 IMMIGRATION SERVICE EXHIBIT "B" SEATTLE WASH

UKRAINIA AND EASTERN GALICIA TWO SEPERATE COUNTRIES WITH SEPERATE AND DISTINCT GOVERNMENTS OF THEIR OWN STOP NOT RECOGNIZED BY UNITED STATES STOP TOWN OF WHICH JACK MATTHEWS IS NATIVE IN NOW IN EASTERN GALICIA AND PASSPORT HAD TO BE SECURED FROM EASTERN GALICIAN REPRESENTATIVE BEFORE DEPORTATION COULD TAKE PLACE STOP WARRANT OF DEPORTATION IS HEREBY AMENDED DIRECTING DEPORTATION OF ALIEN TO EASTERN GALICIA. HENNING 411P
IN THE DISTRICT COURT OF THE UNITED STATES FOR THE WESTERN DISTRICT OF WASHINGTON NORTHERN DIVISION.
IN THE MATTER OF THE APPLICATION OF JOHN MATTHEWS FOR A WRIT OF HABEAS CORPUS
SUPPLEMENTAL RETURN
FILED IN THE UNITED STATES DISTRICT COURT Western District of Washington Northen Division
F.M. Harshberger, Clerk By S.E. Leitch Deputy
